intro: Epilobium × foliosum, commonly known as the common willowherb, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist soils along stream banks, wet meadows, and other damp habitats. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Epilobium × foliosum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support diverse wildlife.
